title: Understanding Enthalpy in a Closed Cycle
text: When a thermodynamic system undergoes a series of processes and returns to its initial state, what can you infer about its total change in a state function like enthalpy?

title: What is a State Function?
text: Remember, a state function's change depends only on the initial and final states of a system, not on the path taken. What does this mean for a full cycle?

title: Calculate Enthalpy Change
text: Since the system returns to its initial state, calculate ΔH using the concept of state functions.

title: Irreversible and Reversible Processes
text: Irrespective of the processes (spontaneous or reversible), how does a cycle impacting state functions differ?

title: Final Answer for Enthalpy Change
text: Identify the correct option based on your understanding of state functions for a closed cycle.
